title: Approved Through 12/2021
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: • Most recent waiver amendment, which includes SUD features, approved on 7/17/2018;demonstration effective 1/9/2017 through 12/31/2021

• Delivery system demonstration authorizing the state’s DSRIP initiative, among other features
  • DSRIP initiative includes projects targeted toward the integration of physical and behavioral health services and strategies to address the opioid crisis; projects focusing on physical/behavioral health integration are part of the state’s strategy for transitioning to integrated managed care products by 2020; lead entities are nonprofit organizations convening providers, behavioral health agencies, and CBOs
  • Provides federal matching funds for behavioral health-related DSHPs
  • Aligns with November 2017 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefitsand has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
Varies by region:

  • Integrated MMC products: Enrollees in two regions of the state; ASO covers SUD crisis services
  • In these regions, populations excluded from managed care (e.g., dual eligibles, medically needy, individuals in an IMD, and long-term care residents) obtain SUD services through BH limited-benefit PIHPs
  • BH limited-benefit PIHPs: Majority of Medicaid population, with the exception of enrollees living in regions with integrated MMC products
  • FFS: AI/AN population
  • State has released an RFP to procure integrated managed care products for remaining regions by 2020

• SBIRT
  • Outpatient services (ASAM 1)*
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)*
  • Residential services, including intensive inpatient services, recovery house services, longterm residential services, and youth residential services (ASAM 3.1 and 3.5)*
  • Sub-acute detoxification (ASAM 3.2-WM)*
  • Acute detoxification (ASAM 3.7-WM)*
  • Acute hospital detoxification (ASAM 4-WM)*
  • MAT/opioid treatment program*
  • MAT/office-based opioid treatment program*

Yes

  • Obtained waiver for SUD
See key SUD-related provisions above

Authority RFP 2019/2020 Integrated Managed Care; 1915(b) Washington State Integrated
Community Behavioral Health Program Waiver; Apple Health Managed Care

title: Approved Through 12/2019
first_heading: Virginia Governor’s Access Plan (GAP) for the Seriously Mentally Ill and Addiction and Recovery Treatment Services (ARTS) Delivery System Transformation Demonstration
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
Waiver amendment with SUD features approved on 9/22/2017; demonstration effective
1/12/2015 through 12/31/2019

BH-focused demonstration with two primary components:

  • GAP: Expands limited Medicaid benefits to childless adults and noncustodial parents with SMI ages 21–64 with incomes up to 100% FPL
  • ARTS: Implements SUD features aligned with July 2015 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefits and has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
•  Integrated MMC plans: Majority of Medicaid population
  •  BH service administrator: Individuals enrolled in GAP and populations excluded from managed care, including individuals residing in an ICF/IID or long-term care facility

• SUD case management 
  • Crisis intervention
  •  SBIRT (ASAM 0.5) 
  • Outpatient services (ASAM 1)
  •  Peer recovery supports (ASAM 1)
  • SUD intensive outpatient services(ASAM 2.1)
  •  SUD partial hospitalization (ASAM 2.5)
  •  Clinically managed low-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.1)^*
  •  Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)^* 
  •  Clinically managed high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.5)^*
  •  Medically monitored intensive inpatient services (ASAM 3.7)*
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4)
  • Opioid treatment program
  • Office-based opioid treatment program
  •  Withdrawal management services

Yes 

  • Obtained waiver for SUD

• Individuals in GAP receive limited-benefit package including outpatient hospital coverage, outpatient medical services, MH case management, outpatient individual and group therapies, prescription drugs, and certain SUD services, among others; benefit package is not considered minimum essential coverage
  •  Individuals in GAP have 12 months’ continuous coverage
Demonstration Approval; Original Waiver Application; ARTS Waiver Amendment Application

title: Waiver Request Undergoing CMS Review
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: Waiver request submitted to CMS on 1/31/2018

•  BH-focused waiver request focused on expansion of SUD and MH benefits for three target populations:
    • o Population #1: Children, adolescents, and parents/caretakers with or at risk of a MH disorder or SUD o Population #2: Individuals ages 18-64 with acute MH needs o Population #3: Adolescents and adults ages 12-64 with SUDs
  • Proposes offering enhanced SUD and/or MH benefits for covered populations
  • Includes SUD features aligned with November 2017 SMD letter; state proposes offering a full continuum of SUD services and seeks a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• FFS administered by ASO: New enhanced BH services covered through demonstration (state has not yet contracted with ASO)
  • FFS: All other BH services (outside the demonstration)

Proposed enhanced benefits include:

  • Community and recovery support services^
  • Intensive case management services^
  • Mobile crisis response services^
  • 23-hour crisis stabilization services^ (population #1 only)
  • Crisis stabilization and observation services^ (population #1 only)
  • Crisis residential stabilization services^ (population #1 only)
  • Peer-based crisis intervention services^ (population #3 only)
  • Early intervention (SBIRT)
  • MAT (ASAM 1)^ (population #3 only)
  • Outpatient MAT care coordination^ (population #3 only)
  • Evidence-based screenings and assessments (ASAM 0.5)^
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1) (population #3 only)
  • Residential treatment services (including ASAM 3.3)^
  • Clinically managed high-intensity residential services--adults (ASAM 3.5)
  • Clinically managed medium-intensity services--youth (ASAM 3.5)^
  • Ambulatory withdrawal management without extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 1- WM)^ (population #3 only)
  • Ambulatory withdrawal management with extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 2-WM)^ (population #3 only)

Yes
• Requests waiver for MH and SUD

Seeks to offer enhanced MH benefit package, including MH day treatment, ACT, and
therapeutic foster care services, for populations #1 and #2

title: Approved Through 12/2020
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
• Most recent waiver amendment (without SUD features) approved on 12/22/2017; demonstration effective 12/30/2015 through 12/31/2020
  • Waiver amendment with SUD features approved on 8/13/2015

• Delivery system reform demonstration that authorizes, among other features: o SUD initiative called Drug Medi-Cal Organized Delivery System (DMC-ODS), which aligns with July 2015 SMD letter; State provides a full continuum of SUD benefits and has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
  • DMC-ODS provides both State Plan benefits and benefits newly authorized under the demonstration
  • Counties have the option of participating in DMC-ODS
  • The full range of DMS-ODS benefits (see below) are only available to Medicaid enrollees
  • residing in a participating county; the more limited State Plan SUD benefit package is available in non-participating counties o Public Hospital Redesign & Incentives in Medi-Cal (PRIME), a follow-up to State???s DSRIP initiative authorized under an earlier version of the demonstration
  • Includes projects to be implemented through designated public hospital systems and district/municipal public hospitals targeted toward addressing primary care/behavioral health integration o Whole Person Care (WPC) Pilots
  • Designed to coordinate physical health, behavioral health, and social services through collaboration among county agencies, health plans, and providers with a focus on vulnerable populations
  • May be led by a city, a county, a city and county, a health or hospital authority, or a consortium of cities, counties, and/or health or hospital authorities
  • Provide access to interventions that would not otherwise be covered by Medicaid (e.g., tenancy-based care management services, county housing pools to support medically necessary housing services, etc.)
  • May select individuals with SUDs or MH disorders as a target population
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
•  County-operated BH limited-benefit PIHPs: All DMC-ODS benefits in DMC-ODS
participating counties
• FFS:
o In counties that are not participating in DMC-ODS: All State Plan SUD benefits
o In counties participating in DMC-ODS: Medically monitored inpatient services,
medically managed intensive inpatient services, medically monitored inpatient
withdrawal management, medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal
management, medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal management, and
SBIRT for populations for populations excluded from managed care (services not
covered by BH limited-benefit PIHPs; excluded populations vary by county)
• MMC plans providing physical health services: In all counties, provide medically monitored
inpatient services, medically managed intensive inpatient services, medically monitored
inpatient withdrawal management, medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal
Management, medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal management, and SBIRT
(services not covered by BH limited-benefit PIHPs) to individuals enrolled in MMC for
physical health services
medicad.description2:
? Waiver amendment request includes SUD
features aligned with November 2017 SMD
letter; state offers a full continuum of SUD
services and seeks a waiver of the IMD
Exclusion

medicad.description:
DMC-ODS benefits:
  • Early intervention (SBIRT) (ASAM 0.5)
  • Outpatient drug-free treatment services (ASAM 1)
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)
  • Partial hospitalization (optional; counties do not have to offer service) (ASAM 2.5)^
  • Residential treatment services: counties are initially required to provide at least one of the ASAM levels below; within three years, they must provide all ASAM levels o Clinically managed low-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.1)^* o Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)^* o Clinically managed high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.5)^*
  • Withdrawal management services: counties are required to provide at least one of the following ASAM levels
    • o Ambulatory withdrawal management without extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 1- WM) o Ambulatory withdrawal management with extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 2-WM) o Clinically managed residential withdrawal management (ASAM 3.2-WM)
  • Medically monitored inpatient services (ASAM 3.7) (provided via MMC plan or FFS)*
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4) (provided via MMC plan or FFS)*
  • Medically monitored inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 3.7-WM) (provided via MMC plan or FFS)*
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 4-WM) (provided via MMC plan or FFS)*
  • Narcotic treatment program/opioid treatment program (methadone, buprenorphine, disulfiram, and naloxone)
  • MAT
  • Recovery services^
  • Case management^
  • Physician consultation
State Plan benefits:
  • Early intervention (SBIRT) (ASAM 0.5)
  • Outpatient drug-free treatment services (ASAM 1)
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)
  • Residential treatment services (for perinatal population only)
  • Medically monitored inpatient services (ASAM 3.7)
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4)
  • Medically monitored inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 3.7-WM)
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 4-WM)
  • Narcotic treatment program (methadone only)
  • MAT
  • Targeted case management (not available statewide)

Yes
  • Obtained waiver for SUD for counties participating in DMC-ODS
  • Length of stay limited to two nonconsecutive 90-day stays per year for adults and two nonconsecutive 30-day stays per year for adolescents; length of stay for criminal justice offenders can be up to six consecutive months
See information above regarding PRIME and WPC Pilots

Demonstration Approval; Original Waiver Application; County Organized Health Systems
Boilerplate Contract; Medi-Cal Moves Addiction Treatment into the Mainstream: Early
Lessons from the DMC-ODS Pilots

title: Approved Through 12/2018
description: SUD-Related Amendment Request Undergoing CMS Review
second_heading: Proposed Changes in Delaware Diamond StateHealth Plan Amendment
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
• Most recent waiver amendment (without SUD features) approved on 12/20/2017 demonstration effective 9/30/2013 through 12/31/2018
  • Waiver amendment with SUD features approved on 12/19/2014
medicad.description2: • Waiver amendment with SUD features submitted to CMS on 6/29/2018; undergoing CMS review

medicad.description:
• Demonstration authorizes State's mandatory MMC program, among other features
  • Waiver features include Promoting Optimal Mental Health for Individuals through Supports and Empowerment (PROMISE), an initiative targeted toward individuals who have an SPMI or SUD and require HCBS "to live and work in integrated settings"
  • Individuals enrolled in PROMISE have access to enhanced MH, SUD, and HCBS benefits and a Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health case manager
  • MMC plans must ensure coordination between FFS PROMISE benefits and BH benefits provided through MMC plans
medicad.description2: • Waiver amendment request includes SUD features aligned with November 2017 SMD letter; state offers a full continuum of SUD services and seeks a waiver of the IMD Exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC plans: State Plan BH benefits for majority of Medicaid population
  • FFS: o PROMISE enhanced BH benefits for individuals eligible for PROMISE (within demonstration) o All State Plan BH benefits for populations excluded from managed care, including individuals enrolled in PACE, individuals residing in an ICF/IID, and individuals in the State's I/DD 1915(c) waiver (outside the demonstration)

PROMISE enhanced benefits for individuals with SUD include:
  • Benefits counseling^
  • Case management^
  • Community-based residential alternative supports that exclude assisted living^
  • Community transition services^
  • Financial coaching^
  • Non-medical transportation^
  • Nursing^
  • Peer supports^
  • Personal care^
  • Respite^
  • Skill-building for individual activities of daily living/chores^
  • Supported employment (both individual and small group)^ Other benefits include:
  • MAT
  • Services delivered by BH practitioner
medicad.description2:
State provides full continuum of SUD services, including:
  • Crisis intervention
  • Outpatient addiction treatment, including MAT
  • Residential addiction treatment services

medicad.description: No

PROMISE enhanced MH benefits include community psychiatric support, treatment/psychosocial rehabilitation, and other services by non-licensed clinical staff including evidence-based practices such as ACT and intensive case management

Demonstration Approval; Waiver Amendment
Application

state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration

medicad.description:
• Most recent waiver extension (without SUD features) approved on 6/8/2018; demonstration effective 8/1/2017 through 6/30/2022
  • Waiver amendment with SUD features submitted to CMS on 11/15/2016; undergoing CMS review

• Demonstration authorizes state’s mandatory MMC program, among other features
  • Waiver amendment seeks expenditure authority to implement pilot in two regions of the state to expand BH, housing, and tenancy benefits available to individuals ages 21+ with SMI, SUD, or co-occurring SMI and SUD who are also homeless or at risk of becoming homeless due to disability
  • Plans participating in pilot would be required to partner with housing providers and local housing coalitions

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC plans: Majority of Medicaid population
  • FFS: Populations exempt or excluded from managed care, including individuals residing in an ICF/IID and medically needy individuals, among others (outside the demonstration)

Proposed enhanced benefits include:
  • Transitional housing services^
  • Tenancy-sustaining services^
  • Mobile crisis management^
  • Self-help peer support^
No

Approved demonstration authorizes specialty managed care plans; one specialty plan focuses
on individuals with SMI
Demonstration Approval

title: Approved Through 12/2018
description: SUD-Related Waiver Amendment Request Undergoing CMS Review

medicad.description:
• Most recent waiver amendment (no SUD features) approved on 10/26/2015; demonstration effective 10/1/2013 through 12/31/2018
  • Waiver amendment request with SUD features submitted to CMS on 8/29/2017; undergoing CMS review

• Demonstration authorizes state’s mandatory MMC program, among other features
  • Waiver amendment seeks to provide pre-tenancy and tenancy supportive housing services
    • for individuals ages 18+ who are any of the following: o Chronically homeless o Homeless/at risk of homelessness and have a severe MH disorder, SUD, or chronic/ complex health needs o Homeless/at risk of homelessness and have frequent ED visits or inpatient hospital stays
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC plans: Majority of Medicaid population
  • BH limited-benefit PIHP: Adults ages 21+ who have SMI or SPMI
  • FFS: Enhanced supportive housing benefits for a limited set of individuals with SUD

• Proposed supportive housing benefits include:

    o Pre-tenancy supports (include screening and assessment, development of housing support plan, assistance with housing search, application preparation and submission, and moving assistance, among other services)^

    o Tenancy supports (include individual housing and tenancy-sustaining services, education and training, teaching dispute resolution with landlords and neighbors, and service care coordination, among other services)^

  • Other current SUD benefits include:

    o Residential SUD services

    o Outpatient SUD services

    o Methadone treatment
No

Approved demonstration authorizes enhanced services, including supportive housing,
supportive employment, and financial management services for individuals with SMI and
SPMI and individuals requiring support for emotional and behavioral disorders

Demonstration Approval; Waiver Amendment Application; RFP Community Care Services
Program

title: Approved Through 6/2023
state_content:
CMS did not approve a number of SUD-related features requested by Illinois, including expenditure authority to:
develop and implement integrated physical and behavioral health homes (e.g., funding for provider training and
capacity building); implement BH workforce training and capacity-building initiatives (e.g., loan repayment,
incentives to work in underserved areas, telemedicine, etc.); provide select benefits for justice-involved
populations 30 days prior to release; and provide federal matching funds for BH-related DHSPs. Additionally, CMS
did not approve Illinois’s waiver requests to delay Medicaid redetermination for justice-involved populations until
180 days after release and auto-enroll justice-involved populations in a MMC plan prior to discharge.
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: Waiver approved on 5/7/2018

• BH-focused demonstration that authorizes nine BH- and HCBS-related pilot programs
  • Aligns with November 2017 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefits
    • and has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
  • Provides expenditure authority to implement the following SUD- and/or MH-related pilots

    • (pilots have capped enrollment and may not operate statewide):

    o Clinically managed withdrawal management services pilot: Covers clinically managed withdrawal management services for up to 11,072 enrollees

    o SUD case management pilot: Covers SUD case management services for up to 2,835 enrollees who qualify for diversion from the criminal justice system

    o Peer recovery support services pilot: Covers peer support services delivered by a recovery coach for up to 320 enrollees with a SUD

    o Crisis intervention services pilot: Covers crisis intervention services delivered at acute care hospitals, PRTFs, or community residential treatment centers with <16 beds for up to 8,493 enrollees who are experiencing psychiatric crisis

    o Evidence-based home visiting services pilot: Covers evidence-based home visits delivered by mental health professionals for up to 1,038 children up to age 5 who were born with withdrawal symptoms and for mothers up to 60 days postpartum whose children have withdrawal symptoms

    o Assistance in community integration services pilot: Covers pre-tenancy supports and tenancy-sustaining services for up to 3,750 enrollees who have a significant number of ED visits/hospitalizations or two or more chronic conditions and are “at imminent risk” of homelessness or institutionalization

    o Supported employment services pilot: Covers pre-employment services (e.g., personcentered employment planning, pre-vocational/job-related discovery or assessment, etc.) and employment-sustaining services (e.g., career advancement services, job coaching, etc.) for up to 3,375 enrollees with serious and persistent MH needs or SUD needs

    o Intensive in-home services pilot: Covers intensive in-home services for up to 18,650 enrollees ages 3–21 who meet the state’s health home eligibility criteria and have significant BH needs

    o Respite services pilot: Covers respite services for up to 3,871 enrollees ages 3–21 who have significant MH needs
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC plans: Majority of Medicaid population
  • FFS: Populations excluded from MMC, including AI/AN population and dual eligibles

• Outpatient services
  • Intensive outpatient services
  • Residential treatment*
  • Medically supervised withdrawal management*
  • MAT*
  • Clinically managed withdrawal management^*
  • SUD case management^*
  • Peer recovery support services^*
  • Evidence-based home visiting services^
  • Assistance in community integration services^
  • Supported employment services^

Yes
  • Obtained waiver for SUD
  • Requested but did not obtain waiver for MH
See key SUD-related provisions above
Demonstration Approval Original Waiver Application

title: Approved Through 12/2021
first_heading: Vermont Global Commitment to Health Demonstration
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
Most recent waiver amendment, which includes SUD features, approved on 6/6/2018;
demonstration effective 1/1/2017 through 12/31/2021

• “Global waiver” encompassing almost entire Medicaid program
  • Authorizes mandatory MMC-like program (described in more detail below) and “investments” in initiatives that increase access to care, improve outcomes, and reduce the uninsured and underinsured populations, among other features
  • Approved “investments” include initiatives related to treating SUD and promoting BH integration
  • Aligns with November 2017 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefits and has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Entire Medicaid population served by integrated MMC-like plans, where the Medicaid agency contracts with the Department of Vermont Health Access (DVHA) to deliver services
  •  CMS treats DVHA as a PIHP

• Early intervention SBIRT (ASAM 0.5)
  • Outpatient services (ASAM 1)
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)
  • Partial hospitalization day treatment, psychosocial rehabilitation services (ASAM 2.5)
  • Clinically managed low-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.1)
  • Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)*
  • Clinically managed high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.5)*
  • Medically monitored intensive inpatient services (ASAM 3.7)*
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4)*
  • Opioid treatment program
  • Withdrawal management services (ASAM 1 to 4-WM)*

Yes

  • Obtained waiver for SUD
  • State has waiver authority to fund MH and SUD services in designated IMDs using managed care savings; by 12/2018, state must submit plan to phase down these expenditures and must eliminate them by 12/2025

• Provides federal matching funds for DSHP provision of MH community rehabilitation and treatment services
  • Authorizes HCBS, including service coordination, residential treatment, supported employment, and respite, for individuals <age 21 with SED
Demonstration Approval and SUD Implementation Plan; Waiver Amendment Application

title: Approved Through 6/2022
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: • Most recent waiver amendment, which includes SUD features, approved on 10/31/2017; demonstration effective 11/1/2017 through 6/30/2022

• Broad demonstration authorizing limited coverage expansions to targeted groups
  • Expands coverage to childless adults ages 19–64 with incomes ≤5% FPL who are chronically homeless or in need of SUD or MH treatment (including justice-involved populations); state does not receive ACA’s enhanced match for this population
  • Aligns with November 2017 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefitsand has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• BH limited-benefit PIHPs: Majority of Medicaid population
  • Integrated MMC plans: Individuals with I/DDs enrolled in Healthy Outcomes Medical Excellence program
  • FFS covers:
  •  SUD services for populations excluded from BH limited-benefit PIHPs (e.g., childless adults ages 19–64 with incomes ≤5% FPL who are chronically homeless or in need of SUD or MH treatment) and populations whose SUD services are carved out of BH limited-benefit PIHPs (e.g., children in foster care)
  •  SUD services carved out of limited-benefit PIHPs (e.g., methadone maintenance services)
  •  SUD services that the BH limited-benefit PIHP in a particular county does not cover (e.g., some BH limited-benefit PIHPs do not provide inpatient SUD services; others do not provide outpatient SUD services)
  •  SUD services for the one county without a BH limited-benefit PIHP

•  Early intervention (SBIRT) (ASAM 0.5)
  •  Outpatient services (ASAM 1)
  •  Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)
  •  Day treatment/psychosocial rehabilitation services (ASAM 2.5)
  • Clinically managed low-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.1)
  •  Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)
  •  Clinically managed high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.5)
  • Medically monitored intensive inpatient services (ASAM 3.7)
  •  Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4)
  • Opioid treatment program
  •  Ambulatory withdrawal management without extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 1-WM)^
  •  Ambulatory withdrawal management with extended on-site monitoring (ASAM 2-WM)
  •  Clinically managed residential withdrawal management (ASAM 3.2-WM)^

Yes

  • Obtained waiver for SUD Other Notable MH-Related Provisions See key SUD-related provisions
See key SUD-related provisions above

Implementation Plan; 1915(b) Prepaid Mental Health Plan Waiver; Utah Medicaid Provider
Manual. Section 1: General Information; Utah Medicaid Provider Manual. Section 2:
Rehabilitative Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

medicad.description:

title: Approved Through 6/2022
state_content:
As part of its September 2017 waiver amendment request, the state requested waiver of the IMD exclusion for
SUD and MH without the existing limitations; CMS denied this request.
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: Most recent waiver amendment approved on 6/27/2018; demonstration effective 6/27/2018 through 6/30/2022

• Demonstration authorizes mandatory enrollment in an MCO, ACO, or PCCM for majority of Medicaid population; other key features include a DSRIP initiative
  • Authorizes enhanced “diversionary” BH services—HCBS BH services provided as alternatives or diversions from inpatient BH settings to community-based services—such as clinical support services for substance abuse, acute treatment services for substance abuse, and structured outpatient addiction programs
  • As part of DSRIP, requires ACOs to establish linkages to BH community partners—CBOs that provide care management for enrollees with SMI, SED, and/or SUD
  • Waives IMD exclusion for a limited set of services
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Varies by populationEnrollees required to enroll in managed care choose one of the following options for BH services:   

              o Integrated MMC plan

             o Integrated ACO

             o BH limited-benefit PIHP

  • FFS: Populations excluded from managed care, including individuals ages 65+ and individuals enrolled in PACE (outside the demonstration, with the exception of certain services delivered to individuals in IMDs)

• Community support program^
  • Acute treatment services for substance abuse^*
  • Clinical support services for substance abuse^*
  • Structured outpatient addiction program^
  • Intensive outpatient program^
  • Clinically managed low-intensity residential services, including 24-hour transitional support services, 24-hour residential rehabilitation services, and 24-hour communitybased family SUD treatment services (ASAM 3.1)^*
  • Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)^*
  • Recovery support navigator services^
  • Recovery coach services^ (available to ACO/MCO enrollees only)
  • Intensive outpatient program^

Yes

  • Obtained waiver for MH and SUD limited to the services listed below:6 o Acute treatment services for substance abuse^*

             o Clinical support services for substance abuse^*

              o Transitional care unit services^*

              o Clinically managed low-intensity residential services, including 24-hour transitional  support services, 24-hour residential rehabilitation services, and 24-hour community-based family SUD treatment services (ASAM 3.1)^*

             o Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)^*

  • Waiver funding is authorized through Safety Net Care Pool and is capped
Enhanced diversionary BH services targeted toward MH include ACT, psychiatric day treatment, and community crisis stabilization
Demonstration Approval; Waiver Amendment Application; Waiver Extension and Amendment Application

title: Waiver Request Undergoing CMS Review
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: Waiver request with SUD features submitted to CMS on 11/20/2017; undergoing CMS review

• Demonstration seeks to implement mandatory MMC for the majority of the Medicaid population, among other features
  •  Seeks to create specialized managed care products for enrollees with significant BH needs, I/DDs, and TBIs that are called behavioral health and intellectual/developmental disability (BH I/DD) tailored plans
  •  Proposes including SUD features aligned with November 2017 SMD letter; state proposes offering a full continuum of SUD services and seeks a waiver of the IMD exclusion
  • Requests comparability waiver to offer more intensive BH benefits, including intensive SUD residential services, only to individuals in BH I/DD tailored plans
  •  Seeks expenditure authority to provide funding to support BH I/DD tailored plans, care management agencies, and providers build capacity (e.g., IT and workforce) to implement BH and I/DD-focused health homes
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Years 1 and 2 of managed care implementation:
  •  Integrated MMC plans (standard plans): Majority of Medicaid population
  •  BH limited-benefit PIHPs: Qualifying individuals with SMI, SED, SUD, I/DD or TBI; HCBS waiver enrollees; dual eligibles; and medically needy individuals
  •  FFS: Populations excluded from BH limited-benefit PIHPs, including children enrolled in CHIP with significant BH needs and legal aliens (outside the demonstration, with the exception of services provided to individuals in IMDs)
  • Years 3+ of managed care implementation:
  •  Integrated MMC plans (standard plans and BH I/DD tailored plans): Majority of Medicaid population, including qualifying individuals (including children enrolled in CHIP) with SMI, SED, SUD, or I/DD
  • FFS: Populations excluded from managed care, including medically needy individuals, certain HCBS waiver enrollees, and dual eligibles without significant BH needs or an I/DD (outside the demonstration, with the exception of services provided to individuals in IMDs)

• Substance abuse halfway house (ASAM 3.1)*
  • Social setting detoxification (ASAM 3.2-WM)*
  •  Clinically managed population-specific high-intensity residential services (ASAM 3.3)* (BH I/DD tailored plans only)
  •  Substance abuse nonmedical community residential treatment (ASAM 3.5)* (BH I/DD tailored plans only)
  •  Substance abuse medically monitored community residential treatment (ASAM 3.7)*
  •  Nonhospital medical detoxification (ASAM 3.7 WM)* (BH I/DD tailored plans only)
  •  Medically supervised or alcohol drug abuse treatment center (ADATC) detoxification crisis stabilization (ASAM 3.9-WM)*
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient services (ASAM 4)*

Yes

  •  Requests waiver for SUD and MH
See information above regarding BH I/DD tailored plans
Original Waiver Application

title: Approved Through 3/2021
description: SUD-Related Waiver Amendment Request Undergoing CMS Review
second_heading: Proposed Changes in Medicaid Redesign Team Demonstration Amendment
state_content:
As part of its May 2017 waiver amendment request, the state requested to transition its 1915(c) waivers serving
children into its 1115 waiver. CMS denied this request and the 1915(c) waivers will operate concurrently with the
1115 demonstration.
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
Most recent waiver amendment approved on
1/19/2017; demonstration effective 12/7/2016
through 3/30/2021
medicad.description2:
Most recent waiver amendment approved on
1/19/2017; demonstration effective 12/7/2016
through 3/30/2021

medicad.description:
• Demonstration authorizes state’s mandatory MMC program, DSRIP initiative, and specialized managed care products for adults ages 21+ with SMI or serious SUD (called Health and Recovery Plans, or HARPs), among other features
  • HARP enrollees have access to an enhanced BH benefit package; benefits are tiered based on an enrollee’s level of need
  •  Utilization of enhanced HARP services is subject to an annual dollar cap
  • DSRIP initiative includes projects targeted toward addressing primary care/BH integration and preventing substance abuse; safety net hospitals are lead entities and form networks of providers and CBOs
medicad.description2:
Seeks to carve BH benefits into integrated
MMC plans for individuals ages <21 (see
additional detail below)8
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC plans: Majority of Medicaid population ages 21+
  • FFS: Individuals ages <21 (within demonstration) and populations excluded from managed care, including spend-down populations and individuals receiving partial benefits, among others (outside of demonstration)
medicad.description2:
• Seeks to transition SUD and MH benefits for individuals ages <21 from FFS to integrated MMC plans; individuals ages <21 will not enroll in HARP
  • Individuals who are excluded or exempt from managed care, including foster care children in the placement of a voluntary agency and individuals age <21 who are permanent residents of residential healthcare facilities, will continue to receive SUD services through FFS

medicad.description:
• HARP enhanced benefits include:
  •  BH HCBS assessment^
  •  Empowerment services—peer supports^
  •  Habilitation services^
  •  Nonmedical transportation^
  •  Family support and training^
  •  Employment supports^
  • Other benefits include:
  • Inpatient and outpatient BH services, including chemical dependency services
  •  Residential addiction services^
  •  Outpatient addiction services^
  • Crisis intervention^
  •  Licensed BH practitioner services^
  • Medically supervised outpatient withdrawal
  • Office of Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Services (OASAS) outpatient and opioid treatment program services
  •  OASAS outpatient rehabilitation programs
  •  Inpatient hospital: Medically managed detoxification (hospital-based)
  •  Inpatient hospital: Medically supervised inpatient detoxification
medicad.description2:
Residential rehabilitation services for youth
(carved out of managed care)

medicad.description: No

• HARP enhanced MH benefits include psychosocial rehabilitation, community psychiatric support and treatment, shortterm crisis respite, and intensive crisis respite
  •  DSRIP initiative includes projects targeted toward addressing primary care/BH integration and MH promotion
Demonstration Approval

* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

• BH- and I/DD-focused waiver request seeking to combine authority for 1915(b) and 1915(c) waivers related to the delivery of BH and HCBS benefits
  • Includes SUD features aligned with July 2015 SMD letter, proposes offering a full continuum of SUD benefits, and seeks a waiver of the IMD exclusion
  • Seeks expenditure authority to implement alternative payment methodologies that promote physical and BH integration between PIHPs providing BH services and MMC plans providing physical health, acute care, and pharmacy services

  • Medically monitored inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 3.7-WM)
  • Medically managed intensive inpatient withdrawal management (ASAM 4-WM)
  • Opioid treatment program, including MAT
  • Targeted case management

title: Approved Through 12/2022
description: SUD-Related Amendment Request Undergoing CMS Review
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
• Most recent waiver extension (without SUD features) approved on 9/1/2017; demonstration effective 1/1/2018 through 12/31/2022
  • Waiver amendment request with SUD features submitted to CMS on 8/28/2018; undergoing CMS review

• Demonstration authorizes limited coverage expansion for up to 21,342 uninsured individuals within incomes ≤100% FPL residing in St. Louis City or St. Louis County; State does not receive ACA’s enhanced match for this population
  • Costs are capped at $4.5 million/year
  • State uses funds that otherwise would have been spent on payments to disproportionate share hospitals to pay for limited coverage expansion
  • Waiver amendment request seeks to add a limited set of SUD and MH services to Gateway to Better Health benefit package for enrollees with a SUD; coverage is not considered minimum essential coverage
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description: • FFS: Gateway to Better Health population; enrollees receive vouchers to use for care at limited set of providers (State obtained waiver of freedom of choice)

• Office visits for SUD treatment, including alcohol and drug treatment programs, group counseling for alcohol and drug treatment, case management, and self-help/peer services  Generic prescriptions for SUD treatment
No
For individuals with SUD, State also seeks to cover office visits for MH services such as psychotherapy, MH partial hospitalization, and ACT
Demonstration Approval; Waiver Amendment Application

title: Approved Through 6/2022
state_content:
New Jersey has not yet transitioned all populations and services to the ASO. As the state undertakes this
transition, SUD services are delivered through either a cost reimbursement model or FFS.
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description:
Waiver amendment request with SUD features approved on 10/31/2017; demonstration
effective 10/31/2017 through 6/30/2022

• Demonstration authorizes state’s mandatory MMC program and DSRIP initiative, among other features
  • DSRIP initiative includes projects targeted toward screening for SUDs, and increasing use of ED alternatives for individuals with alcohol intoxication; hospitals are lead entities
  • Includes SUD features aligned with November 2017 SMD letter; state provides a full continuum of SUD benefits and has obtained a waiver of the IMD exclusion
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• ASO: Majority of Medicaid population for most SUD services7
  • Physical health MCO: Majority of Medicaid population for a limited set of SUD services, such as detoxification in a medical bed
  • Integrated MMC plan: Dual eligibles enrolled in a Medicare special needs plan and individuals enrolled in an MLTSS MCO

• Early intervention (SBIRT)
  • Outpatient services (ASAM 1)
  • Intensive outpatient services (ASAM 2.1)
  • Partial care services (ASAM 2.5)
  • Long-term residential services (ASAM 3.5)*
  • Short-term residential services (ASAM 3.7)*
  • Ambulatory withdrawal management services (ASAM 2-WM)
  • Withdrawal management services (ASAM 3.7-WM)*
  • MAT*
  • Peer support*
  • Targeted case management*

Yes

  • Obtained waiver for SUD

• Expands Medicaid eligibility to youth <age 21 with SED with incomes ≤150% FPL; population is eligible for limited benefit package including State Plan benefits and HCBS
  •  Expands Medicaid eligibility to youth <age 21 with co-occurring I/DD and mental illness with incomes ≤300% FPL; population is eligible for State Plan benefits and HCBS
Demonstration Approval; Original Waiver Application; SUD Implementation Plan

title: Approved Through 12/2020
state_content:
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD

medicad.description: Waiver approved on 1/5/2016; demonstration effective 1/5/2016 through 12/31/2020

• Demonstration authorizes state’s DSRIP initiative, which seeks to transform the state’s BH delivery system through the creation of regionally based integrated delivery networks (IDNs) of behavioral health and other types of providers
  • Requires IDNs to design and implement projects that:

              o Increase community-based BH capacity; reduce unnecessary ED and inpatient utilization for BH conditions; and promote prevention of BH issues

             o Promote physical or virtual integration of physical and BH providers

             o Promote successful transitions of care and coordination across settings

  • Requires IDNs to adopt alternative payment methodologies
  • Creates IDN Transformation Fund to pay IDNs for meeting performance milestones
  • Provides federal matching funds for BH-related DSHPs
medicad.category_name: Waiver Design Summary and Key SUD-Related Waiver Features

medicad.description:
• Integrated MMC products: Majority of Medicaid population
  • QHP premium assistance: Expansion adults (outside of demonstration; will transition to MMC in 2019)
  • FFS: Children with SSI and spend-down populations, among others
Not specified
No
See key SUD-related provisions above
